newsitem.title: UK: British Airways keeps cargo fuel surcharges.
newsitem.headline: British Airways keeps cargo fuel surcharges.

text.p: British Airways World Cargo said Thursday it had not yet made any decision to drop cargo surcharges it introduced from November 8 last year.
Since then, the carrier has been charging a six UK pence per kg charge on intercontinental freight rates and three pence per kg on European and UK routes.
During October/November 1996, many airlines introduced cargo surcharges to counter rapidly rising fuel costs.
Recently, three major international airlines -- Delta, Virgin Atlantic and United -- announced they are dropping surcharges.

American Airlines and Air Canada have, like BA, said they will continue to levy surcharges until further notice while other carriers are discussing the situation. - Reuters Air Cargo Newsroom Tel +44 171 542 7706 Fax +5017
